answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Emily – I don’t know any local government’s Councils or Boards that do not have a public comment period during public meetings. I’ve seen varying degrees, such as:

Unlimited public comment on anything that is not agendized
Limit of 3-minute per public comment speaker
Limit of 10-minutes total for public comment period
Public comment at the end of agenda
Public comment at the beginning of the agenda

Pam

I would recommend Mohave County, Arizona for your study. They recently added public comment to their Supervisor's agenda. I'm sure you can google and find numerous newspaper articles about the change.

author: Emily Baker-White
text:
I am looking for information about the nature and prevalence of oral public comment in local deliberative bodies (e.g. zoning boards, county commissions, etc.) nationwide. I hope to find out what percentage of bodies guarantee their citizens the right to speak at meetings, and to find out what types of bodies most often extend these speaking rights/privileges. 
Please let me know if you have any research that addresses this question (or questions similar to it). I also hope to complete my project within the next few days; please try to answer my question as soon as you can.
title: Public comment in local government bodies
